author: Morgan Park
description: Battlefield has caught up to Call of Duty in a major way.
title: Battlefield 6 is making an excellent case to skip Call of Duty this year

author: Ted Litchfield
description: Nox Mortalis is an unholy combo of survival game and old school RPG.
title: Somebody spilled some Minecraft in this hardcore first-person RPG, and I love the result way more than I ever thought possible

author: Andy Chalk
description: Despite its troubles, Strauss Zelnick promises BioShock 4 is not at risk of being cancelled.
title: 'Consumers are not okay with okay': Take-Two boss says BioShock 4 is taking so long because the company's goal is 'to make the best entertainment, not necessarily the most entertainment'

author: Wes Fenlon
description: It's not bad! But I'm not sure it's the Ninja Gaiden I hoped for.
title: Ninja Gaiden 4 plays more like a Platinum action game than classic Ninja Gaiden, and I'm really not sure how to feel about it

author: Tyler Colp
description: The Brazilian roguelike has a full roadmap of updates on the way.
title: Just 2 weeks after its release, this Diablo-style roguelike has already reworked its entire campaign to please action RPG fans looking for a challenge

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: Sure!
title: Finally, I can get a straight flush with cabbages: Our favorite idle farming sim just got a Balatro crossover

author: Andy Chalk
description: One year after the Doom + Doom 2 bundle, id Software and Nightdive Studios has done it again.
title: Id Software kicks off QuakeCon with a surprise release of Heretic + Hexen, an 'enhanced' bundle with cross-platform multiplayer, mod support, and more

author: Wes Fenlon
description: What year is it? Who cares: Castle Crashers is forever.
title: I cannot believe one of the best indie games of all time just got new DLC 17 years later

author: Christopher Livingston
description: A new study claims steering AI into "evil" behavior somehow makes it less prone to evil in the long run.
title: Deliberately giving AI 'a dose of evil' may make it less evil overall, reads headline on ragged newspaper in the rubble of the robot apocalypse

author: Andrea Shearon
description: Based on criteria I just made up, that's a violation of the community bylaws.
title: I'm sick of the survival crafting 'Cube' and calling the gamer HOA on all of you

author: Andy Chalk
description: Contraband was announced in 2021 as a partnership between Avalanche Studios and Xbox.
title: It looks like Microsoft's cuts got another one: Avalanche has stopped work on its 1970s smuggling sim Contraband to 'evaluate the project's future'

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: Life used to be more than this.
title: I'm so tired of being advertised at, man

author: Andy Chalk
description: RedOctane Games is being headed up by Guitar Hero veteran Simon Ebejer, and includes original founders Kai and Charles Huang as "advisors."
title: Embracer brings original Guitar Hero publisher RedOctane back from the dead for 'the next evolution in rhythm gaming'

author: Robin Valentine
description: "We believe this launch will happen."
title: Marathon will be out before March 2026, says Sony CFO—but 'this is not a commitment'

author: Zak Storey
description: Further proof that it's not just the controller that makes the SSD.
title: Acer Predator GM9000 2 TB NVMe SSD review

author: Mollie Taylor
description: No Tekken Tag Tournament 3?
title: As tag fighters face a resurgence, Tekken's director says it won't be joining in on the fun: 'There's just so much more knowledge that's necessary to enjoy the game'

author: James Bentley
description: That's dedication.
title: A creator spent multiple days streaming themself unfolding a Samsung Fold 200,000 times and at one point, 'an unknown black liquid came out of the hinge, but it has not appeared again'

author: Zak Storey
description: Ridiculously affordable, with potent sequentials.
title: Biwin Black Opal NV7400 SSD review

author: Nick Evanson
description: The overall numbers follow expectations, but there are some glitches in this matrix for sure.
title: Purported Amazon GPU sales figures suggest that a lot of PC shoppers are buying some truly ancient graphics cards

author: Harvey Randall
description: Finally, Mario is safe from being used to raise money for charity.
title: Nintendo scores a masterful own-goal by forcing its games out of a 9-year old charity speedrunning event, tells organisers those 9 years 'constituted unauthorized use' for good measure

author: Jeremy Laird
description: A slightly odd sales pitch given Perplexity's investors include Jeff Bezos and Nvidia...
title: Trump Media and Perplexity team up for 'Truth Search AI,' a new tool in the fight against 'Big Tech's assault on free speech'

author: Andy Edser
description: Nordic refinement, now in gaming headset form.
title: Fractal Design Scape review

author: Andy Chalk
description: Bungie was intended to operate as an "independent subsidiary" when it was acquired in 2022, but that hasn't worked out.
title: Sony has seen enough: 3 years after acquiring Bungie, Sony says the days of independence are over and its future 'is to become part of PlayStation Studios'

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: AI? More like A-I would rather not.
title: Microsoft's beta Gaming Copilot AI is now available for Xbox Insiders, to 'help you get to gameplay faster, sharpen your skills, and be there when you need it and out of the way when you don’t'

author: Mollie Taylor
description: Did we really need another Persona 5 crossover?
title: The Fortnitification of every videogame is really starting to grate on me

author: Harvey Randall
description: Emotions are more than just nice, sassy, and mean.
title: The dialogue wheel was the worst thing to happen to RPGs, it's robbed us all for years, and I'm glad it's dying out

description: A little reward goes a long way, and there are plenty of codes to redeem.

description: And the winner is...

author: Joshua Wolens
description: And then it goes and spoils it all by saying something stupid like "blockchain."
title: Habbo Hotel survives years of 4chan raids to declare it's still alive for a 25th-anniversary jamboree

author: Christopher Livingston
description: In Guntouchables, battle mobs of mutants to secure the most important supplies of the post-apocalypse: beer and toilet paper.
title: This new 4-player co-op 'doomsday shooter' is free to own forever during its first 24 hours on Steam

description: Grab your wicker basket and get whisked away to Portobello.
title: Out and About is exactly what I want from a foraging game and has convinced me that I could easily make a meal out of what I find in my back garden

author: Jeremy Laird
description: This is all getting a bit much.

author: James Bentley
description: It has found a way to keep costs down.

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Pour one out for the helicopters.
title: Battlefield 6's open beta is already the most popular Battlefield of all time on Steam, and the platform's 44th most-played game ever

author: Harvey Randall
description: Straight-up cruising.

author: Jeremy Laird
description: Missed deadlines, poor execution, and a misguided strategy. Ouch.
title: Save Intel's fabs before 'the rust of time makes them worthless': Four former Intel board members want a joint venture between Nvidia, Qualcomm, Google, Amazon, Apple, Broadcom and others to create an 'American Foundry'

author: Joe Donnelly
description: Ah sh*t, here we go again…

description: We need to be honest about the cosy game tag.

description: The defendants allegedly received $1 million payments from China-based companies.
title: Alleged three-person smuggling operation accused of shifting tens of millions of dollars’ worth of AI chips to China potentially faces up to 20-year prison sentence

author: Harvey Randall
description: There's gotta be some more water to wring outta this stone somewhere.

description: Triumph over the Everdark Fissure in the Fog expedition and defeat its hardy frost dragon.

description: It's good news for TSMC.
title: Computer chips made outside the US to receive 100% tariff likely spiking tech prices, but 'there's no charge' for companies currently building on American soil

title: OpenAI's new open-weight reasoning model can be run locally on an RTX card but you still need a pretty beefy rig to run it

description: Suffering from success.
title: If you're doubting whether Battlefield 6 will be a hit, I was stuck in a 140,000 player queue at 9 am on a random Thursday to join a closed beta, twice

description: A woman faces an eight year prison sentence as a result.

description: I'm too scared to play it alone.

description: Get ready for the next battle.
